jobs.title: Security Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
TL;DR – We’re looking for a Security Engineer to raise the bar for how fast-moving AI teams stay secure. You’ll work with infra, ML, and product teams to protect our stack without slowing us down. This is a high-leverage role for someone who wants to build security into the core of everything we ship.

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.

We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

What we’re looking for

  • 5+ years of experience securing modern cloud-native environments, ideally at product-focused tech companies or early-stage startups or top-tier AI labs.

  • Deep knowledge of securing engineering infrastructure: CI/CD pipelines, secrets, service-to-service auth, containerized environments, and public cloud.

  • Strong systems mindset - you're comfortable diving into infra code, writing tools, and contributing directly to engineering workflows.

  • Track record and intuition to design pragmatic security controls that don’t slow teams down.

  • Bonus: You’ve shipped internal security tools or open-sourced relevant infra.

What you’ll do

In one sentence: Help us build and ship AI products at extremely high velocity without compromising on security.

  • Identify high-leverage surfaces across Lovable’s engineering stack, from CI/CD and auth to product endpoints.

  • Design and implement tooling that helps developers go the secure route by default.

  • Own detection, triage, and response for vulnerabilities and incidents - internal and external.

  • Collaborate with infra, ML, platform and product engineers to embed security into everything we build.

  • Track emerging risks in AI infra, LLM pipelines, and third-party integrations, and close the gaps before they matter.

Our tech stack

We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:

  • Frontend: React for lightning-fast interfaces

  • Backend: Golang and Rust for serious performance

  • Cloud: Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS, Terraform

  • DevOps & Tooling: CI/CD pipelines, observability, infra-as-code

And always on the lookout for what's next!

About your application

  • Please submit your application in English - it’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join

  • We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal

jobs.title: Legal Counsel
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Tl;dr
We’re hiring our first in-house lawyer. You’ll be the person in the trenches: owning enterprise deals, fixing our contracting engine, and building the day-to-day legal workflows that let Lovable scale without breaking. This isn’t a “big GC” job – it’s a hands-on role for someone who loves rolling up their sleeves, negotiating hard, and putting legal structure in place at high speed.

Why Lovable?

  • Change the world, literally: 2025 is the year AI works. Lovable is building the most powerful AI software-creation platform.

  • Work with exceptional people: We’re assembling one of Europe’s strongest technical teams. You’ll work alongside founders, execs, and sales leaders closing deals with the world’s largest enterprises.

  • Legal as a growth lever: At Lovable, legal is not “back office.” Done right, you’ll be a direct driver of revenue velocity and customer trust.

  • Top-of-market comp: Cash + equity. We pay above market for impact, not pedigree.

  • Global stage: We’re a top AI brand. You’ll interact with leading companies, regulators, and advisors across the US, EU, and beyond.

What we’re looking for
Must-haves:

  • 6–12 years’ legal experience, with at least 2-4 years in-house at a high-growth tech company (Series A–C ideal).

  • Strong commercial contracting + enterprise negotiation skills – you know how to drive deals across the line without losing leverage.

  • Foundation across privacy, IP, corporate, and employment law.

  • Familiarity with US and cross-border contracting.

  • Builder mindset: you enjoy fixing broken templates, designing workflows, and creating clarity in chaos.

  • Bias for action—you’d rather solve and improve than write long memos.

  • Willing to be based in Stockholm (or open to relocate).

Nice-to-haves

  • Experience in AI, devtools, infra, or other frontier tech companies.

  • Familiarity with global privacy / data laws (GDPR, CCPA, AI Act, SCCs).

  • Exposure to equity programs and corporate governance.

  • Comfort collaborating with sales, product, and exec teams directly.

What you’ll do

  • Enterprise sales enablement: Own redlines, negotiations, and customer legal processes. Be the closer’s ally.

  • Contracting infrastructure: Standardize templates, playbooks, and approval flows. Make contracts fast, repeatable, and scalable.

  • Day-to-day legal ops: Be the go-to lawyer for the company – triage issues, prioritize ruthlessly, and know when to escalate.

  • Risk translator: Turn complex legal questions into clear, practical guidance for product, sales, and leadership.

  • External counsel manager: Use outside firms efficiently, but keep critical calls in-house.

  • Scale prep: Build the systems now (templates, governance, compliance hygiene) that make later audits and fundraising easy.

The Challenge
This is not a job for someone who wants to “manage” or “delegate.” You’ll be hands-on, detail-obsessed, and directly responsible for the nuts and bolts of legal. Think redlines, workflows, contract systems, and day-to-day calls from sales/product. You’ll also have the chance to influence how Lovable’s legal function grows – but only after showing you can get the work done in the trenches first.

How we hire

  1. Short application + conversation with hiring team.

  2. Case-style exercise (simulating a real-life Lovable scenario).

  3. Working session with key stakeholders (half-day, remote or onsite).

  4. References → offer.

Ready to make legal the engine that powers the most exciting AI company in the world?

Apply below.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
TL;DR - We’re seeking exceptional Fullstack Product Engineers to help build the future of AI. You will work across our entire stack to build features that will empower the next generation of creators and builders.

Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. What we’re looking for

  • Drive the full development lifecycle, from technical planning to production launch and post-release improvements

  • Contribute to shaping our technical direction, eng culture, and product strategy

TL;DR - We’re looking for world-class product designers to help shape Lovable. You’ll lead projects end-to-end, collaborating closely with engineering. We expect a broad range of design skills, and exceptional taste. You’ll join a team at the forefront of AI, enabling anyone to create software.

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.

We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

What we’re looking for

  • A track record of working in high performing, fast-paced startup environments

  • A portfolio showcasing successful product work loved by users and produced in high-velocity teams

  • Talent for simplifying complicated user journeys into intuitive experiences

  • Strong prototyping abilities with emphasis on clear visual communication

  • Fluency with design systems and technical implementations

  • Outstanding command of visual design, UI patterns, and interaction principles

  • High aptitude for shipping and learning extraordinarily quickly

  • Bonus: You ship to production, perhaps with a little help from AI

  • Bonus: Experience designing AI products

What you’ll do

In one sentence: Design Lovable, making it the most Lovable piece of software ever.

  • Craft detailed user flows and high-fidelity mockups for new features

  • Own design projects from conception to delivery, collaborating with engineering or ideally implementing yourself with AI (we'll train you)

  • Be scrappy and hands on with any design assets needed

  • Establish scalable design processes that uphold quality standards

  • Champion quick wins and impactful improvements

  • Contribute to improving the design quality of Lovable's AI

  • Help set the bar for design quality and the culture for how design works at Lovable

How we hire

  1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.

  2. We'll send you a quick take-home asking to present your best work over a loom video presentation.

  3. Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your experience in more depth

  4. Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote or on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.

Important Note:

  • Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.

  • We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

jobs.title: Growth Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Tl;dr: We’re looking for a full-stack growth engineer who’s product-obsessed. One month you’ll ship a feature that users can’t stop talking about. The next, you’ll tear into funnels, loops, and onboarding to make them 10x tighter. You think in code, but your instinct is always: will this make the product better and our users more successful?

Coding skills + excellent taste + growth instincts + product obsession = you.

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, solve complex problems, and bring their dreams to life. And we’re just getting started.

We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value high ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek people who care deeply, challenge us, and are driven to build something of lasting impact.


What we’re looking for

  • 5+ years of experience building and growing products with high-performing teams

  • Skilled at designing, measuring, and iterating experiments based on evidence

  • Thorough and detail-oriented in setting up growth systems “right” from the start

  • Strong product sense with ability to frame problems, prioritize bets, and push the right ones forward

  • Motivated by technology that makes a difference and by seeing impact through measurable results

What you’ll do

In one sentence: Do what it takes to build a predictable, sustainable, and competitively defensible growth model for Lovable.

  • Build new product features & experiences

  • Build and run A/B tests to optimize product-led growth loops (viral, referral, UGC).

  • Deploy the fastest solution possible to validate ideas and scale the ones that work.

  • Help manage integrations with other apps - MCP and API based.

  • Keep the product experience relentlessly Lovable while making growth the engine, not the afterthought.

Our tech stack

We're building with tools that both humans and AI love:

  • Frontend: React

  • Backend: Golang and Rust

  • Cloud: Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, Many LLM providers

  • DevOps & Tooling: Github Actions, Grafana, OTEL, infra-as-code (Terraform)

And always on the lookout for what's next!

How applying works

  1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.

  2. Join us for a round of technical interviews

  3. Team intro calls with the team

Apply by clicking the link below.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.

We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

What we’re looking for

  • Proven track record of leading product launches targeting enterprise clients, Fortune 500 companies.

  • Strong ability to craft compelling product messaging and positioning that resonates with diverse enterprise audiences, translating complex technical concepts into clear, engaging narratives for non-technical stakeholders.

  • Strong analytical skills with experience using data to optimize messaging and enhance the product experience for large organizations.

  • Bonus: Experience marketing AI products to enterprise clients.

  • Refine our core messaging and positioning to shape how enterprise clients understand what Lovable does and why it is essential for their operations.

jobs.title: Customer Marketing Manager
jobs.descriptionHtml:
TL;DR - We're looking for a Customer Marketing Manager to uncover and amplify the incredible stories of users building with Lovable. From solopreneurs building their first revenue-generating app to enterprise teams shipping products in hours instead of months, our customers are doing lovable things—and the world needs to hear about it. You'll build systems to discover these stories and craft compelling narratives that inspire and convert.

What We're Looking For

  • 5+ years in customer marketing or storytelling-focused role.

  • Proven track record creating compelling customer case studies.

  • Experience building content sourcing systems and processes.

  • Strong writing and narrative skills with portfolio.

  • Comfort with both B2B and B2C segments.

  • Video production and storytelling experience. Preferably from a “user” perspective.

  • Understanding of software development or no-code tools.

  • Creativity. We want to bring customer stories to life in compelling ways, and are looking for someone who thinks outside of the box.

What You'll Do

  • Create scalable processes to identify customer success stories across B2B, B2C, and everything in between.

  • Monitor social channels, forums, and communities for organic testimonials.

  • Develop customer relationships to capture transformation stories.

  • Build workflows to systematically gather impact data.

  • Transform user experiences into compelling case studies, video testimonials, and social proof campaigns.

  • Create content that resonates across different audience segments.

  • Identify users building unique, ambitious, or unexpectedly successful products.

  • Document "impossible made possible" moments that demonstrate Lovable's potential.

  • Bring a creative lens to how we tell stories across a variety of channels and mediums, from video and audio to print and digital.

The way we tell our story will define not just our growth, but how the world understands what’s possible in software creation. This role is central to shaping that narrative, scaling our reach, and ensuring more users fall in love with Lovable.

How we hire

  1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.

  2. Complete the take-home exercise.

  3. Join us for a round of interviews to discuss your take-home exercise.

  4. Join us for trial work lasting 1-2 days remote/on-site. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.

jobs.descriptionHtml:

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with any language. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

What we’re looking for

As an AI Product Manager-in-Residence at Lovable, you’ll operate as both a strategic advisor and a builder — helping executives and product teams reimagine how they ideate, prototype, and launch in an AI-native world.

Think of this as AI Product Management-as-a-Service: part transformation consultant, part creative technologist.

You’ll guide C-level stakeholders through what’s possible with AI, design proof-of-concepts that bring those visions to life, and help organizations evolve how they operate, from quarterly planning cycles to daily experimentation loops.

What you’ll do

  • Advise executives on the future of work: Partner with design, product, and innovation leaders to identify where AI can drive speed, creativity, and leverage across teams.

  • Lead strategic discovery workshops: Run sessions with cross-functional leaders to uncover opportunities for AI-powered transformation — from faster prototyping to automated data exploration.

  • Design and deliver AI-native apps: Translate strategic goals into working prototypes and internal tools that demonstrate new ways of operating.

  • Build the bridge between business and engineering: Act as the connective tissue between C-suite vision and technical execution, ensuring outcomes, not outputs.

  • Run iteration and learning loops: Establish continuous feedback cycles with customers and Lovable’s product team to evolve both the client’s workflows and Lovable’s core platform.

  • Measure and communicate impact: Define metrics that quantify acceleration — time-to-prototype, decision velocity, adoption — and translate them into business outcomes.

  • Shape the narrative: Serve as a thought partner and storyteller who can inspire executives about the future of AI-native product development.

Example engagements

As an AI product manager at Lovable, you might:

  • Accelerate data analysis and dashboard creation:
    A Fortune 100 product team, frustrated by slow internal analytics, used Lovable to build an AI Data Explorer that connects directly to their databases and auto-generates interactive dashboards for experiment insights. You guided leadership on how to restructure their experimentation workflow around AI speed.

  • Enterprise tooling for complex environments:
    A global fintech enterprise leveraged Lovable to create secure, AI-built internal tools connected to self-hosted systems. You helped the CTO’s office develop an AI adoption roadmap and operating model for internal app development.

  • Rapid prototyping for new product concepts:
    A large consumer brand’s innovation team used Lovable to test new digital product ideas within days. You partnered with design leadership to redefine their product validation process — from months-long design cycles to weekly prototype sprints.

Each engagement blends advisory and execution: you’re not just delivering apps — you’re shaping how entire organizations build, decide, and ship in an AI-native era.

You’ll thrive here if you

  • Have 7-10 years of experience in Product Management or strategic technology consulting.

  • Combine executive presence with technical fluency — comfortable advising C-level leaders and diagramming architectures in the same meeting.

  • Are a systems thinker who connects AI capabilities to business outcomes, team design, and operating cadence.

  • Have led or advised AI or digital transformation programs at scale.

  • Thrive in ambiguity and love turning complex customer environments into structured, repeatable success stories.

  • Care deeply about craft, clarity, and human impact — ensuring AI makes work faster and more meaningful.

How we hire

  1. Fill in a short form then jump on an initial exploratory call.

  2. Discuss your experience in more depth during a round of interviews with us.

  3. Join us for a workshop lasting 1-2 days remote or onsite. We'll see how you tick and you get to meet the team and explore whether joining Lovable feels right for you.

About your application

  • Please submit your application in English. It’s our company language so you’ll be speaking lots of it if you join.

  • We treat all candidates equally - if you’re interested please apply through our careers portal.

TL;DR - We’re looking for a Privacy and Compliance Engineer who thrives at the intersection of technology, regulation, and trust. One week you’ll be shaping our global privacy framework. Next, you’ll be working hand-in-hand with engineers to design compliant yet frictionless AI-powered features. You think about risks and safeguards, but your instinct is always: how do we protect users while enabling Lovable to move fast and build boldly? Deep privacy knowledge + practical compliance instincts + ability to ship with engineering = you.

Why Lovable?

Lovable lets anyone and everyone build software with plain English. From solopreneurs to Fortune 100 teams, millions of people use Lovable to transform raw ideas into real products - fast. We are at the forefront of a foundational shift in software creation, which means you have an unprecedented opportunity to change the way the digital world works. Over 2 million people in 200+ countries already use Lovable to launch businesses, automate work, and bring their ideas to life. And we’re just getting started.

We’re a small, talent-dense team building a generation-defining company from Stockholm. We value extreme ownership, high velocity and low-ego collaboration. We seek out people who care deeply, ship fast, and are eager to make a dent in the world.

What we're looking for

  • 5+ years in data protection, privacy, or compliance roles ideally ideally as an engineer.

  • Deep understanding of GDPR, EU AI Act, and global privacy frameworks.

  • You are experienced in building tools, scripting, or coding solutions to automate compliance checks and procedures, enabling privacy features to be deployed at scale.

  • You have a builder mindset and don’t just write policies, you design practical frameworks that scale with product and engineering.

  • You can balance compliance requirements with business realities. You know when to push back and when to propose pragmatic solutions.

  • Skilled communicator. Clear, confident, and persuasive. Able to explain complex regulations to engineers, execs, and customers alike.

  • Privacy is often about details. You notice what others miss and care about getting it right.

  • Comfortable working in a high-velocity startup where laws evolve and priorities shift quickly. Nothing is beneath you, from reviewing a DPIA to jumping on a customer compliance call.

  • Passionate user of Lovable.

What You’ll Do

In one sentence: Build and lead an engineering-first and world-class privacy and compliance function that lets Lovable scale responsibly and globally.

  • Own and evolve Lovable’s privacy and compliance strategy.

  • Ensure GDPR, EU AI Act, and other global requirements are embedded into product and operations - ideally, by you,or your close peers under your supervision.

  • Create and deploy automated solutions that enable privacy controls (such as data anonymization, access logging, or consent management) to be rolled out efficiently across large-scale environments.

  • Lead risk assessments, DPIAs, and audits - finding how to improve and scale Lovable as the most secure, compliant and safe company and product.

  • Manage security, privacy, and compliance certifications (ISO, SOC 2, etc.) together with our security and infra teams.

  • Educate and enable the team and make privacy and compliance something everyone understands and takes pride in. Security advocacy.

  • Be the voice of trust and support customer conversations and represent Lovable externally on compliance and privacy matters.

Our environment

We move fast and build with both humans and AI in mind. You’ll work closely with engineers and product managers using:

  • Tech: React, Golang, Rust, Cloudflare, GCP, AWS, multiple LLM providers.

  • Infra & Tooling: GitHub Actions, Grafana, Terraform, OTEL.

  • IT: MacOS, Kandji, Crowdstrike, Google Workspace

  • Process: Privacy by design, security by default, continuous iteration.

And always on the lookout for what's next.
